active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the trade-offs of using full backups exclusively versus hybrid strategies (full + incremental/differential) in terms of storage costs, backup windows, and recovery speed. Use real-world examples like WannaCry ransomware recovery to support your arguments and reference NIST CSF or CIS Controls.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt:
You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Bloom's Taxonomy, active learning, and scaffolding. Generate 20 high-quality flashcards on 'Full Backup Methods' (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Asset Security > Data Security Controls > Data Backup and Recovery > Backup Strategy and Architecture > Full Backup Methods). Incorporate these learning objectives: [insert learning_objectives array]. Ensure flashcards span all Bloom's levels (at least 3-4 per level: REMEMBER/UNDERSTAND, APPLY/ANALYZE, EVALUATE/CREATE). Use this 4-layer scaffolding for content progression: [insert scaffolding object]. Draw from research context: Full backup = complete data copy; RPO/RTO definitions; NIST CSF Recover (planning/testing backups); CIS Controls (Control 11: Data Recovery - tested, offsite, immutable backups); pros/cons vs. incremental/differential; tools (Veeam, Acronis); examples (WannaCry); misconceptions (full always optimal/slowest). Link to active learning: Infuse prompts referencing discussion (pros/cons debate), peer teaching (tool demos), problem-solving (scenarios). Prerequisites: Assume knowledge of file systems, basic data storage. Output 20 flashcards strictly in this JSON format per card: { 'id': 1, 'bloom_level': 'REMEMBER', 'scaffolding_layer': 'Foundation', 'front': 'Question text?
A) Distractor1
B) Correct
C) Distractor2
D) Distractor3', 'back': { 'correct_answer': 'B', 'explanation': 'Full explanation with rationale, distractor debunks, source, learning tie-in.', 'active_learning_hint': 'E.g., Use in peer teaching demo.' } } Follow flashcard schema: MCQ with 4 options, plausible distractors (misconceptions/partial truths/edges), explanations <100 words. Ensure variety: 30% foundation terms, 25% comparisons, 25% scenarios/tools, 20% evaluation/design. Make engaging, precise, assessable.
